writer.name: 西亚马克·埃特玛迪 Siamak Etemadi

director.name: 西亚马克·埃特玛迪 Siamak Etemadi

introduction: In the fading light of day, a man is gazing at the wild sea. He is solitary, almost feral-like, and he roams naked in the wild landscape. The following day finds him asleep on a flat rock in a fetal position, completely attuned to the harsh environment that surrounds him. All of a sudden, a woman approaches from the open sea, swimming towards him. She is a stranger in his land, but he already feels an unquenched, raw, and primal attraction that demands to be satisfied, regardless of any barriers between them. In a visceral manner, the man's solitude will entwine with the woman's personal turmoil, and together, they will stand powerless before nature's cruel beauty. The conflict is constant, and the only way out is this wrecked and abandoned boat. Why is the woman running away from him, and what lies in the islet ahead?
